discussion.content:
A. User Access Administrator

To use Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to automatically monitor permissions and create and implement right-size roles while following the principle of least privilege, you should assign the User Access Administrator role to the service principal of Permissions Management.

The User Access Administrator role allows the service principal to manage user access to Azure resources, including the ability to grant and revoke access, but it does not grant excessive permissions such as Contributor or Owner roles. This aligns with the principle of least privilege, ensuring that the service principal has the necessary permissions to perform its tasks without unnecessary access to modify resources.
